display_asset.caption: Officials in Iran preparing a noose for an execution in 2014. Amnesty International said in its annual report that almost 90 percent of the executions that it recorded last year were carried out in Iran, Pakistan and Saudi Arabia.

summaries.body: At least 1,634 people were executed last year, the highest total in a quarter-century, Amnesty International said in its annual report on capital punishment.

display_asset.caption: Buffalo Bills linebacker AJ Tarpley, shown intercepting a pass against the New York Jets in January, announced his retirement from the N.F.L. on his Instagram account.

summaries.body: A.J. Tarpley, a 23-year old linebacker with the Buffalo Bills, will retire from the N.F.L. because of repeated concussions, the latest young player to walk away from football.

display_asset.caption: Female Navy recruits in Great Lakes, Ill. They were among the first women to be issued the white hats for enlistees, or Dixie cups, as part of the Navy’s efforts for uniformity in service members’ uniforms.
display_asset.credit: U.S. Navy photo by Sue Krawczyk

summaries.body: The Navy distributed the iconic hats called Dixie cups (also known as “dog dishes” and “squid lids”) to female recruits, part of an effort to make its uniforms gender-neutral.

display_asset.caption: Smokeless tobacco products are now banned at New York City athletic facilities that issue tickets.

summaries.body: Newly signed legislation prohibits the use of smokeless tobacco at New York City sports facilities that issue tickets, including Yankee Stadium and Citi Field.

display_asset.caption: Kesha as she left New York State Supreme Court in Manhattan in February.

summaries.body: A New York State judge rejected claims of emotional and sexual abuse by the pop singer Kesha in her legal fight against the producer Dr. Luke.

display_asset.caption: The writer Calvin Trillin, center, at an after-party in New York at the restaurant China Grill. He has written extensively about cuisine, including Chinese food in the United States.
display_asset.credit: Christian Hansen for The New York Times

summaries.body: Critics say a poem in The New Yorker by the writer Calvin Trillin, about the varieties of Chinese cuisine now available, is dismissive and possibly racist.
Democratic lawmakers in Ohio called for an investigation after a politician said young Republicans would get preference for summer jobs at a state agency.

display_asset.caption: The newly discovered Shakespeare First Folio is bound in three volumes.

summaries.body: Just in time for the global commemoration of the 400th anniversary of Shakespeare’s death, a previously unknown First Folio has been unveiled.

display_asset.caption: Allie Long (23) scoring with a header during the United States’ rout of Colombia in an exhibition game Wednesday.
display_asset.credit: Mark L. Baer/USA Today Sports, via Reuters

summaries.body: As they fight for equal pay, the United States women’s national soccer team whipped outclassed Colombia, 7-0, while drawing another large audience.
An entire village in Britain that has been owned by one family for over 150 years is on sale for about $28 million. The offer includes a mansion, 43 homes and a pub.
The Consumer Products Safety Commission has recalled 20,000 Ivanka Trump scarves because of flammability risks. The scarves are made of rayon in China.
Unmarried couples in Florida can now live together without fear of legal repercussions. The state’s governor signed into law a bill repealing a 148-year-old ban.
France's Parliament has passed a bill to discourage prostitution by penalizing clients who pay for sex. First-time offenders will be fined about $1,700.

display_asset.caption: Gay Talese, whose comments on female writers at a conference in Boston put him in an unfamiliar forum — on Twitter.

summaries.body: Gay Talese set off a Twitter storm after he was asked which female writers inspired him most. The 84-year-old nonfiction writer replied: "None."

display_asset.caption: Stephen Curry and the Golden State Warriors lost Tuesday night and now must win their last four games to break the 1995-96 Bulls’ record.

summaries.body: The Golden State Warriors' recent losses have further diminished their chances of achieving the best regular-season record in N.B.A. history.

display_asset.caption: The Advertising Standards Authority in Britain ruled that this model in a Gucci ad looked “unhealthily thin.”

summaries.body: The Advertising Standards Authority of Britain has banned the image of a model deemed "unhealthily thin" in a Gucci ad, fanning the debate on unhealthful body image.

display_asset.caption: North Korean surveillance cameras atop a steel tower peer into the South, near the border village of Panmunjom.

summaries.body: North Korea could deploy a rocket system as early as this year that would expand its ability to strike forces in the South, South Korea’s defense minister said.

display_asset.caption: Augusta Uwamanzu-Nna

summaries.body: For the second time in two years, a student from Elmont Memorial High School on Long Island has been accepted to all eight Ivy League universities. "It's so surreal," Augusta Uwamanzu-Nna said.

display_asset.caption: A tiger at the Phnom Tamao Wildlife Rescue Center in the Cambodian province of Takeo last year.

summaries.body: In an attempt to prevent the extinction of wild tigers in Cambodia, a small number will be imported and introduced to the last place in the country where one was seen.

display_asset.caption: Jeanie Ditty and an image of her 2-year-old daughter, Macy, which was superimposed in the photo after she died. Ms. Ditty has been charged in her death.

summaries.body: A photographer who retouches pictures to include dead relatives has been the target of social-media vitriol now that the mother in one of his images has been charged in the beating death of the daughter who is seen consoling her.

display_asset.caption: The beach at Fort Adams State Park in Newport, R.I. “Rhode Island: Cooler and Warmer,” a new slogan intended to help the state attract tourists and businesses, encountered a backlash on social media.

summaries.body: A new logo and slogan, “Rhode Island: Cooler and Warmer,” created a furor that resulted in the resignation of the state’s marketing chief.

display_asset.caption: Juan R. Carlos

summaries.body: A passenger who got behind the steering wheel of an Uber car so that the driver could nap led the police on a highway chase in central New York, the State Police said.

display_asset.caption: People at an Internet bar in Beijing. China’s system of Internet controls, known as the Great Firewall, blocks access to certain foreign websites.

summaries.body: During a presentation on digital security, the architect of China's "Great Firewall" was forced to use location-masking software to reach websites in South Korea.
George Mason University renamed its law school for Justice Antonin Scalia, but revised the new name after the first attempt yielded an unflattering acronym.

posts.footer: — Hilde Kate Lysiak, responding to critics of her reporting on a murder in her town, Selinsgrove, Pa. She is 9. The Washington Post

summaries.body: If you want me to stop covering news, then you get off your computers and do something about the news.

display_asset.caption: Stephen Curry and the Golden State Warriors lost Tuesday night and now must win their last four games to break the 1995-96 Bulls’ record.

summaries.body: The Golden State Warriors lost in overtime to the last-place Minnesota Timberwolves, seriously damaging their quest to set a season record by winning 73 games.

display_asset.caption: Part of the stretch of pavement Yankees fans had to walk along to collect StubHub tickets before Tuesday’s game.
display_asset.credit: Edwin J. Torres for The New York Times

summaries.body: Yankees fans who purchased tickets from StubHub had to walk nearly a mile from Yankee Stadium in the cold to pick up their tickets instead of printing them at home.
Two economists say they have found a correlation between participation in religious activities and the wage gap, with an increase in one being related directly to an increase in the other.

display_asset.caption: Mick Jagger performing in Havana last month.
display_asset.credit: Mauricio Lima for The New York Times

summaries.body: The Rolling Stones are preparing to release their first studio album since 2005. The album, the group's 30th, will have a distinctly bluesy flavor.
Parents who have difficulty sleeping tend to think that their children also have sleep problems, Finnish researchers have found.
